qas.question: What is the first goal when attempting to analyze a new text?
Why is finding the first exemplar important in textual criticism?
The exemplar is otherwise known as what?
The final product of reconstruction is known as what?
What is the second goal when attempting to analyze a new text?

plausible_answers.text: the constitutio (reconstruction of the original) is considerably advanced.

qas.question: Why is finding the last exemplar important in textual criticism?
The first product of reconstruction is known as what?
The middle product of reconstruction is known as what?
The final product of reconstruction is known as what?

context: Maas comments further that "A dictation revised by the author must be regarded as equivalent to an autograph manuscript". The lack of <b8_0>autograph<b8_0/> manuscripts applies to many cultures other than Greek and Roman. In such a situation, a key objective becomes the <a0_0>identification of the first exemplar<a0_0/> before any <a1_0>split in the tradition<a1_0/>. That exemplar is known as <a2_0>the archetype<a2_0/>. "If we succeed in <b4_0>establishing the text of [the archetype]<b4_0/>, <a3_0><b5_0>the <b6_0><b7_0>constitutio<b7_0/><b6_0/><a3_0/> (reconstruction of the original) is considerably advanced.
